name: BBCWorld
text:
RT @bbcworldservice: In 1963, four black girls were killed in a racist attack on the 16th Street Baptist Church in the US city of Birmingham, Alabama.

Sarah Collins Rudolph, who survived the bombing, aged just 12, says their deaths forced the attackers to confront their hate https://t.co/JKTyBMlQs3 https://t.co/nHP6r3aFej

name: BBCWorld
text: RT @BBCWorld: Global coronavirus infections top 30 million https://t.co/zxdID1r25n

name: BBCWorld
text:
Surging coronavirus figures across Europe should be "a wake-up call", the World Health Organization's regional director says

In the past two weeks the number of new cases has doubled in more than half of European member states, Hans Kluge notes

[Thread]

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S

name: BBCWorld
text:
"Although these numbers reflect more comprehensive testing, it also shows alarming rates of transmission‚Äù

The WHO says 300,000 new infections were reported across Europe last week alone; weekly cases exceeded those reported during the first peak in March

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/Gp3zl9giN0

name: BBCWorld
text:
Though younger people currently make up the largest proportion of newly recorded coronavirus cases there are fears of many more cases of serious illness if the virus spreads to older and more vulnerable groups

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/Yn2G6H12H6

name: BBCWorld
text:
Latest data from the World Health Organization shows more than five million confirmed coronavirus cases and more than 228,000 fatalities across Europe since the pandemic began

Cases in several countries have risen sharply in recent weeks

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/KlnirNIe96

name: BBCWorld
text:
Yesterday France recorded 10,593 coronavirus cases - the country's highest daily number since the pandemic began

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/xejNOWbi9h

name: BBCWorld
text:
On Wednesday, Spain recorded 239 new coronavirus deaths, their highest number since June

Many of the country's new infections have been in the capital Madrid, where authorities are planning to announce new lockdown measures

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/hQvu3km20U

name: BBCWorld
text:
The Czech Republic has also reported more than 2,000 daily Covid-19 cases for the first time 

The country's prime minister called on people to follow the rules to prevent an exponential increase in infections

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/DJ9JRR7KB8

name: BBCWorld
text:
In the Netherlands, confirmed coronavirus cases have also reached a new daily peak 

The government are expected to announce new coronavirus measures today

https://t.co/CaIt5USI8S https://t.co/N9njJ2LrQY

name: BBCWorld
text: Follow the latest data, and see how coronavirus continues to spread in countries around the world: https://t.co/XZbxHrNZTx

name: BBCWorld
text:
"I wasn't about to miss my first Grammys, even if my face crashed right down onto the piano keys"
